article.title: Size and density sorting of dust grains in SPH simulations of protoplanetary discs

multiple_choice_question.text: Which group of chondrites generally exhibits the smallest average chondrule diameter?
Which group of chondrites has an Fe/Si ratio closest to that of CI chondrites (considered the solar standard)?
The Urey-Craig diagram shows a trend of increasing (Fem + Fes)/Si ratio with increasing (Feoxidized)/Si ratio. Which group of chondrites deviates most strongly from this trend?
This figure shows the radial size distribution of different dust species.  Which statement best describes the relationship between optimal drift size and grain density?
choices: Optimal drift size is independent of grain density.
Denser grains have a larger optimal drift size compared to lighter grains.
Lighter grains have a smaller optimal drift size compared to denser grains.
Denser grains have a smaller optimal drift size compared to lighter grains.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Equation 4, which of the following would lead to an increase in the midplane optimal drift size (s_mid) for a given dust species?
What is the primary driver of vertical settling in the early stages of the simulation, as depicted in Figure 6?
